item.title: Hearings - Hearing on adapting non-contractual civil liability rules to artificial intelligence - 30-01-2025 - Committee on Legal Affairs
item.description:
On 30 January 2025, the Committee on Legal Affairs will hold a public hearing on the Commission proposal for a Directive on adapting non-contractual civil liability rules to artificial intelligence (AILD - 2022/303(COD)).

The public hearing would focus on the content of the Commission proposal, which aims to address very specific aspects on non-contractual liability of the Member States, which have not been subject to harmonisation at the Union level yet. The proposal aims to adapt civil non-contractual liability rules to new challenges posed by AI.

Speakers will address topics essential for understanding AI civil non-contractual liability, such as on existing national civil liability rules, burden of proof and its reversal in civil procedure, use of presumptions in civil procedure, debate on the additional impact assessment as requested by JURI, etc.


Location : Brussels

Programme
Contribution by Prof. Dr. Philipp Hacker, LL.M.
Photos

Source : © European Union, 2025 - EP

item.title: Highlights - Vote on discharge and exchange of views with Commissioner McGrath - Committee on Legal Affairs
item.description:
On 29 January 2025, the JURI committee will hold a public hearing on Harmonising certain aspects of insolvency law. The Committee will also hold an exchange of views with Michael McGrath, Commissioner for Democracy, Justice, the Rule of Law and Consumer Protection.

On 30 January 2025, the JURI committee will vote on 2023 discharge: General budget of the EU - Court of Justice of the European Union. Finally, the Committee will hear a presentation of the EPRS study on the 'Proposal for a directive on adapting non-contractual civil liability rules to artificial intelligence: Complementary impact assessment'. Th Committee will also hold a hearing on the proposal for a Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council on adapting non-contractual civil liability rules to artificial intelligence (AI Liability Directive).

Hearing on AI Liability

item.title: Hearings - Hearing on Harmonising certain aspects of insolvency law. - 29-01-2025 - Committee on Legal Affairs
item.description:
On 29 January 2025, the Committee on Legal Affairs will hold a public hearing on Harmonising certain aspects of insolvency law.

The proposal for a Directive to harmonise certain aspects of insolvency law is an important piece of legislation for the Committee on Legal Affairs, with far-reaching implications for businesses, creditors, and investors across all Member States, making it essential to foster an informed legislative process.
The hearing will provide an important platform for stakeholders, including policymakers, industry representatives, practitioners and academia to present their perspectives and insights. Given the complexity of the matter, the public hearing would facilitate a deeper understanding of the directive's implications, identify key challenges, and highlight areas requiring further refinement.

Location : Brussels

Programme
Contribution by Prof. Dr. Bjoern Laukemann
Contribution by François Charles Desprat
Contribution by Sophie Jacmain
Webstreaming
Photos

Source : © European Union, 2025 - EP

item.title: Other events - Study ‘One in, one out’ - 04-12-2024 - Committee on Legal Affairs
item.description:
On 4 December 2024, the JURI Members heard the presentation of the study ‘One in, one out’ by Prof. Dr Helen Xanthaki. This study was commissioned by the European Parliament’s Policy Department for Citizens’ Rights and Constitutional Affairs at the request of the JURI Committee. The study submits that ‘One in, one out’ is a tool for less, not better, regulation and legislation, and, as such, it is not a suitable instrument for better law-making.

Location : European Parliament, Brussels

Study ‘One in, one out’
Presentation by Prof. Dr Helen Xanthaki
Biography of Prof. Dr Helen Xanthaki
JURI Briefing - The 'one in, one out' by Prof. Dr Helen Xanthaki

Source : © European Union, 2025 - EP

item.title: Briefing - Proceedings - The 'one in, one out' principle - A real better lawmaking tool? - PE 768.964 - Committee on Legal Affairs
item.description:
Professor Dr Xanthaki presented to JURI Committee a critical analysis of the "The 'one in, one out' principle - A real better lawmaking tool?". She concluded that the principle may lead to less (not better) legislation, purely on a arithmetical basis, and recommended to JURI Committee to focus on genuine better law-making tools, including a modernized, citizen-centred drafting structure and style for EU legislation, which she considered not fit for purpose in its current style. This briefing was commissioned by the European Parliament’s Policy Department for Citizens’ Rights and Constitutional Affairs at the request of the JURI Committee.

Source : © European Union, 2025 - EP

item.description:
AMENDMENTS 1 - 20 - Draft opinion 2023 discharge: General budget of the EU - Court of Justice of the European Union
Committee on Legal Affairs
Ilhan Kyuchyuk

Source : © European Union, 2024 - EP

item.title: Highlights - Consideration of draft opinion, exchange of views, expert presentations and votes - Committee on Legal Affairs
item.description:
On 4th and 5th December 2024, the JURI committee considered the draft opinion on the 2023 discharge: General budget of the EU (Court of Justice of the European Union) and voted on the decision to enter into interinstitutional negotiations regarding the dossier Compulsory licensing for crisis management and amending Regulation (EC) 816/2006. Members furthermore held an exchange of views on the Proposal for the AI Liability Directive (2022/0303(COD)).

The Legal Affairs committee additionally hosted the Commission's presentation on the outcome of negotiations on the draft Council of Europe Convention on the protection of the environment through criminal law. The committee furthermore, organized an interparliamentary meeting with National Parliaments on eJustice. Finally, two experts in the fields presented the following two studies to Members: the "One in, one out" and the "Public benefits status and CMD systems for associations and non-profit organisations in the EU".


Draft agenda
Meeting documents

ICM Meeting on E-justice: lessons learned from national perspectives

item.title: Hearings - ICM Meeting on E-justice: lessons learned from national perspectives - 04-12-2024 - Committee on Legal Affairs
item.description:
The Committee on Legal Affairs, in cooperation with the Legislative Dialogue Unit of the Directorate for Relations with national Parliaments (DG PART), is organising an Interparliamentary Committee Meeting (ICM) on 'E-justice: lessons learned from national perspectives'. The event will take place on 4 December 2024, from 10.30-12.30.

The JURI Members and Members of national Parliaments of the EU Member States will have the chance to discuss the opportunities and challenges in the area of e-justice as regards civil and commercial matters.


Location : European Parliament, ANTALL 4Q1

Programme
Participants list
Mr Kalle Laanet: Digitalisation of Courts in Estonia

Source : © European Union, 2024 - EP
